content: Hey, the checks for my PR seem stuck on getting cancelled. What should I do? https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/84746
@Joshua Nelson Same thing happened again.
@XAMPPRocky you shouldn't be pushing to a rust-lang branch I suspect
try closing in favor of one on your fork?

simulacrum said:

XAMPPRocky you shouldn't be pushing to a rust-lang branch I suspect

Does that make a difference? I usually open the relnotes prs in the rust-lang remote.
Not sure. It's my best guess. Generally we shouldn't be creating branches on the rust-lang remote though.

simulacrum said:

(They create noise for all cloners)

I don't disagree, but it can sometimes be way more convenient to use upstream, for example when you're testing and editing changes across multiple machines, and you don't want to have to deal with setting up your GitHub authentication across all of these machines.
hm not sure I follow, cloning from your fork should need just as much auth as from rust-lang remote?

simulacrum said:

hm not sure I follow, cloning from your fork should need just as much auth as from rust-lang remote?

I'll try to come up with a more concrete example, but I believe an org which has 2FA has stricter auth, but that might be SSO.
